name: Real-Time Button Monitoring Dashboard
description: This project showcases communication, powered by Rust, between the hardware and a web interface.
Built a multi-crate system including device firmware, a Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) listener, and an Axum WebSocket server to process and display live button events.
It connects an embedded micro:bit v2 (running custom firmware) via BLE to a host-side listener.
The listener forwards the device's button events to an Axum-based WebSocket server, which then broadcasts the data to a web dashboard for live, real-time visualization.

name: Rust Auth Service
description: Full-Stack Rust Authentication Service: Built a robust authentication service using Axum (HTTP) and Tonic (gRPC), handling user signup, login, and secure API communication.
Security & Persistence: Implemented JWT for session management with secure HTTP cookies, used Argon2 for password hashing, and used PostgreSQL with SQLx migrations for persistent user storage.
Advanced Features: Included optional email-based 2FA and integrated Redis for real-time token revocation (banned tokens).
Containerized Deployment: Designed for quick deployment with pre-configured Docker/Docker Compose setup, ensuring service isolation and portability.
